cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi (65 km) SE of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the Greater Antilles, forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico early next week and curve toward the north-west Gulf Coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central or southwest Louisiana coast (near the TX-LA border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches and warnings limited to Puerto Rico, U.S./British Virgin Islands, Hispaniola, southeastern Bahamas and Turks & Caicos.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same areas as above – no Gulf Coast warnings in effect at this time.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas to Alabama is in the 5-day cone and could experience impacts mid-week.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of tropical-storm-force (≥39 mph) winds; breezy conditions possible mid-week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (1–2 ft) possible along the upper Texas coast if the storm tracks closer, but significant inundation is not expected with the current forecast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain around 26 Aug, locally higher if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls could temporarily reduce visibility and create choppy harbor seas, but major operational disruptions are not currently anticipated.
